column2: a block of organized, reusable code, used to perform a sigle, related action
named entity in a function (or method) that specifies an argument that the function can accept
reserved memory location used to store value
value passed to function (or method) when calling the function
an associative array, where arbitrary keys are mapped to values
an immutable sequence of Python objects, defined with parentheses or without them
character encoding standard for representing English characters as numbers
a file containing Python definitions and statements
a mutable datatype written as a list of comma-separated values between square brackets
a contiguous set of characters represented in quotation marks
a numeric type with unlimited precision
a type of loop used for repeating code until a defined condition is no longer met
process by which Python code in one module is made available to Python code in another module
a type of statement allowing user to execute a statement or group of statements multiple times
an object capable of returning its members one at a time
